[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are being linked with several potential new signings ahead of the January transfer window.

[Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) has enjoyed an impressive start to life as United's new head coach. The 39-year-old oversaw his first win as Reds boss on Thursday night with the 3-2 victory over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Amid the action on the pitch, United are seeing themselves credited with an interest in players they could potentially sign in the New Year. The [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-transfer-news) is fast approaching, which will give Amorim the opportunity to strengthen his newly inherited squad for the second half of the campaign.

Here, MEN Sport takes a look at some of the latest United transfer news and gossip that have generated headlines over the last 24 hours.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United meet Jorge Mendes over possible Geovany Quenda transfer**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-meet-geovany-quendas-30482307)

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim reveals Manchester United's drastic change in preparations for Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-manchester-uniteds-30479149)**

United are continuing to be linked with a move for Atalanta midfielder Ederson. According to journalist [Alfredo Pedulla](https://www.alfredopedulla.com/il-retroscena-ederson-manchester-united-una-rincorsa-dalla-scorsa-estate/), United are still monitoring the Brazilian ahead of a potential move either in January or next summer.

The report claims that United would prefer to sign Ederson at the end of the season when the summer transfer window opens. Atalanta are reported to have set an asking price of €60million (£50million) for the midfielder.

It has been reported that United are determined to sign a new midfielder to strengthen Amorim's squad. Ederson has been identified as the ideal target, and the club will continue to monitor the 25-year-old throughout the rest of the campaign.

Elsewhere, United are being linked with a move for Juventus duo Douglas Luiz and Nicolo Fagioli. According to [Gazzetta dello Sport](https://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/28-11-2024/mercato-juve-chi-arriva-se-partono-fagioli-e-douglas-luiz.shtml?refresh_ce), the Serie A club are weighing up the possibility of allowing the midfield duo to leave the club in 2025.

The report claims that Juventus sporting director Cristiano Giuntoli has already travelled to Manchester with the purpose of trying to agree deals for Luiz and Fagioli's exits. It has been reported that United are a potential destination for both players, as are Man City, with a move in January a realistic possibility.

data: {"title":"Man Utd transfer 'decision' emerges as club chief has 'talks' over January deal","description":"Latest Manchester United transfer news and gossip with updates on Atalanta midfielder Ederson and Juventus duo Douglas Luiz and Nicolo Fagioli","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-transfer-decision-emerges-30485248","content":"Man United transfer 'decision' emerges as club chief holds 'talks' over double January deal - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Man United transfer 'decision' emerges as club chief holds 'talks' over double January deal
===========================================================================================

Latest Manchester United transfer news and gossip with updates on Atalanta midfielder Ederson and Juventus duo Douglas Luiz and Nicolo Fagioli
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

[Mark Wakefield](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/mark-wakefield/)

*   03:30, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Dan Ashworth with Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim.](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30349897.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2184191794.jpg)

Dan Ashworth with Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim. (Image: Photo by Ash Donelon/Manchester United via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

[Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are being linked with several potential new signings ahead of the January transfer window.

[Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) has enjoyed an impressive start to life as United's new head coach. The 39-year-old oversaw his first win as Reds boss on Thursday night with the 3-2 victory over Bodo/Glimt in the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league).

Amid the action on the pitch, United are seeing themselves credited with an interest in players they could potentially sign in the New Year. The [January transfer window](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-transfer-news) is fast approaching, which will give Amorim the opportunity to strengthen his newly inherited squad for the second half of the campaign.

Here, MEN Sport takes a look at some of the latest United transfer news and gossip that have generated headlines over the last 24 hours.

**READ MORE:** [**Manchester United meet Jorge Mendes over possible Geovany Quenda transfer**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-meet-geovany-quendas-30482307)

**READ MORE: [Ruben Amorim reveals Manchester United's drastic change in preparations for Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-manchester-uniteds-30479149)**

United are continuing to be linked with a move for Atalanta midfielder Ederson. According to journalist [Alfredo Pedulla](https://www.alfredopedulla.com/il-retroscena-ederson-manchester-united-una-rincorsa-dalla-scorsa-estate/), United are still monitoring the Brazilian ahead of a potential move either in January or next summer.

The report claims that United would prefer to sign Ederson at the end of the season when the summer transfer window opens. Atalanta are reported to have set an asking price of €60million (£50million) for the midfielder.

It has been reported that United are determined to sign a new midfielder to strengthen Amorim's squad. Ederson has been identified as the ideal target, and the club will continue to monitor the 25-year-old throughout the rest of the campaign.

Elsewhere, United are being linked with a move for Juventus duo Douglas Luiz and Nicolo Fagioli. According to [Gazzetta dello Sport](https://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Juventus/28-11-2024/mercato-juve-chi-arriva-se-partono-fagioli-e-douglas-luiz.shtml?refresh_ce), the Serie A club are weighing up the possibility of allowing the midfield duo to leave the club in 2025.

The report claims that Juventus sporting director Cristiano Giuntoli has already travelled to Manchester with the purpose of trying to agree deals for Luiz and Fagioli's exits. It has been reported that United are a potential destination for both players, as are Man City, with a move in January a realistic possibility.

Joshua Zirkzee gets major Man United transfer update as new Ruud van Nistelrooy option emerges
==============================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as we take a look at some of the stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   03:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United's Joshua Zirkzee during the Premier League match at Portman Road, Ipswich.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485388.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ipswich-Town-v-Manchester-United-Premier-League-Portman-Road.jpg)

Joshua Zirkzee has been linked with a move away from Manchester United ahead of the January transfer window. (Image: Bradley Collyer/PA Wire.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

It’s back to [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) action for Manchester United this weekend as [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) takes charge of his first league game at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The new United head coach managed his first game at the Stadium on Thursday night. Goals from [Alejandro Garnacho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) (x2) saw the team come out as 3-2 winners over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are back in action on Sunday when they take on Everton at Old Trafford (1.30pm kick-off). Going into the match, United sit in 12th place in the Premier League table, having picked up 16 points from their opening 12 games.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-duo-show-true-30485198)**

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

While we wait for the match, there has, as ever, been stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford. We have therefore taken a look at a couple and also given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### Van Nistelrooy new job confirmed

[Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been [confirmed as the new manager of Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), following his exit from Manchester United just under three weeks ago. The former striker joined United in the summer as Erik ten hag’s assistant and took interim charge for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

He has now signed a two-and-a-half year deal with the Foxes and will hope to lead the club to Premier League safety. It means a reunion with United is on the cards, with the meeting between the two clubs set for March 15 at the King Power Stadium.

_**MEN Sport Says**: After a successful stint as interim boss, it’s good to see Van Nistelrooy get a chance to manage in the Premier League and United fans will be watching how he gets on with interest. United could also make the most of the new link between the two clubs in the transfer window._

_Leicester may be keen to take some of United’s players either on loan (they will however have to free up a loan space in their squad in order to do so), or permanent deals. The link could be useful to both teams going forward and provides a new option for players struggling to break through at Old Trafford._

#### Joshua Zirkzee stance outlined

Ahead of the January transfer window, there has been a lot of talk over [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee), with Juventus linked with an interest in a potential loan deal just six months after he joined the club.

However, journalist Gianluca Di Marzio has now given the latest, confirming that a move to the Italian giants is not going to happen. “Joshua Zirkzee and Douglas Luiz are linked to other teams every day,” he told [Soccernews.nl](http://soccernews.nl/).

“Zirkzee to Juventus or Douglas Luiz back to the Premier League or Saudi Arabia, but they are out of the market at this moment. There are no chances or no discussion between Man Utd and the agent or Juventus and the agent, so they are happy to stay in Man Utd and Juventus.

“They want to stay at their clubs and demonstrate their values, so that´s not going to happen in January.”

_**MEN Sport Says:** While Zirkzee has had a slow start to life at Old Trafford, I think it’s best for the striker that he stays at United, especially given the arrival of Ruben Amorim. While he is struggling for starts, Zirkzee is still yet to miss a Premier League game this season, so it’s not like he’s not getting any game time._

_Working under Amorim will only benefit the 23-year-old. And he will hope to reap the benefits both the rest of the season and next season._

Joshua Zirkzee gets major Man United transfer update as new Ruud van Nistelrooy option emerges
==============================================================================================

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as we take a look at some of the stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Amie Wilson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/amie-wilson/)

*   03:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United's Joshua Zirkzee during the Premier League match at Portman Road, Ipswich.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485388.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ipswich-Town-v-Manchester-United-Premier-League-Portman-Road.jpg)

Joshua Zirkzee has been linked with a move away from Manchester United ahead of the January transfer window. (Image: Bradley Collyer/PA Wire.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

It’s back to [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) action for Manchester United this weekend as [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) takes charge of his first league game at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The new United head coach managed his first game at the Stadium on Thursday night. Goals from [Alejandro Garnacho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) (x2) saw the team come out as 3-2 winners over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are back in action on Sunday when they take on Everton at Old Trafford (1.30pm kick-off). Going into the match, United sit in 12th place in the Premier League table, having picked up 16 points from their opening 12 games.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-duo-show-true-30485198)**

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

While we wait for the match, there has, as ever, been stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford. We have therefore taken a look at a couple and also given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### Van Nistelrooy new job confirmed

[Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been [confirmed as the new manager of Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), following his exit from Manchester United just under three weeks ago. The former striker joined United in the summer as Erik ten hag’s assistant and took interim charge for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

He has now signed a two-and-a-half year deal with the Foxes and will hope to lead the club to Premier League safety. It means a reunion with United is on the cards, with the meeting between the two clubs set for March 15 at the King Power Stadium.

_**MEN Sport Says**: After a successful stint as interim boss, it’s good to see Van Nistelrooy get a chance to manage in the Premier League and United fans will be watching how he gets on with interest. United could also make the most of the new link between the two clubs in the transfer window._

_Leicester may be keen to take some of United’s players either on loan (they will however have to free up a loan space in their squad in order to do so), or permanent deals. The link could be useful to both teams going forward and provides a new option for players struggling to break through at Old Trafford._

#### Joshua Zirkzee stance outlined

Ahead of the January transfer window, there has been a lot of talk over [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee), with Juventus linked with an interest in a potential loan deal just six months after he joined the club.

However, journalist Gianluca Di Marzio has now given the latest, confirming that a move to the Italian giants is not going to happen. “Joshua Zirkzee and Douglas Luiz are linked to other teams every day,” he told [Soccernews.nl](http://soccernews.nl/).

“Zirkzee to Juventus or Douglas Luiz back to the Premier League or Saudi Arabia, but they are out of the market at this moment. There are no chances or no discussion between Man Utd and the agent or Juventus and the agent, so they are happy to stay in Man Utd and Juventus.

“They want to stay at their clubs and demonstrate their values, so that´s not going to happen in January.”

_**MEN Sport Says:** While Zirkzee has had a slow start to life at Old Trafford, I think it’s best for the striker that he stays at United, especially given the arrival of Ruben Amorim. While he is struggling for starts, Zirkzee is still yet to miss a Premier League game this season, so it’s not like he’s not getting any game time._

_Working under Amorim will only benefit the 23-year-old. And he will hope to reap the benefits both the rest of the season and next season._

![Image 1: Manchester United's Joshua Zirkzee during the Premier League match at Portman Road, Ipswich.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485388.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ipswich-Town-v-Manchester-United-Premier-League-Portman-Road.jpg)

It’s back to [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) action for Manchester United this weekend as [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) takes charge of his first league game at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The new United head coach managed his first game at the Stadium on Thursday night. Goals from [Alejandro Garnacho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) (x2) saw the team come out as 3-2 winners over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are back in action on Sunday when they take on Everton at Old Trafford (1.30pm kick-off). Going into the match, United sit in 12th place in the Premier League table, having picked up 16 points from their opening 12 games.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-duo-show-true-30485198)**

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

While we wait for the match, there has, as ever, been stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford. We have therefore taken a look at a couple and also given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### Van Nistelrooy new job confirmed

[Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been [confirmed as the new manager of Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), following his exit from Manchester United just under three weeks ago. The former striker joined United in the summer as Erik ten hag’s assistant and took interim charge for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

He has now signed a two-and-a-half year deal with the Foxes and will hope to lead the club to Premier League safety. It means a reunion with United is on the cards, with the meeting between the two clubs set for March 15 at the King Power Stadium.

_**MEN Sport Says**: After a successful stint as interim boss, it’s good to see Van Nistelrooy get a chance to manage in the Premier League and United fans will be watching how he gets on with interest. United could also make the most of the new link between the two clubs in the transfer window._

_Leicester may be keen to take some of United’s players either on loan (they will however have to free up a loan space in their squad in order to do so), or permanent deals. The link could be useful to both teams going forward and provides a new option for players struggling to break through at Old Trafford._

#### Joshua Zirkzee stance outlined

Ahead of the January transfer window, there has been a lot of talk over [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee), with Juventus linked with an interest in a potential loan deal just six months after he joined the club.

However, journalist Gianluca Di Marzio has now given the latest, confirming that a move to the Italian giants is not going to happen. “Joshua Zirkzee and Douglas Luiz are linked to other teams every day,” he told [Soccernews.nl](http://soccernews.nl/).

“Zirkzee to Juventus or Douglas Luiz back to the Premier League or Saudi Arabia, but they are out of the market at this moment. There are no chances or no discussion between Man Utd and the agent or Juventus and the agent, so they are happy to stay in Man Utd and Juventus.

“They want to stay at their clubs and demonstrate their values, so that´s not going to happen in January.”

_**MEN Sport Says:** While Zirkzee has had a slow start to life at Old Trafford, I think it’s best for the striker that he stays at United, especially given the arrival of Ruben Amorim. While he is struggling for starts, Zirkzee is still yet to miss a Premier League game this season, so it’s not like he’s not getting any game time._

_Working under Amorim will only benefit the 23-year-old. And he will hope to reap the benefits both the rest of the season and next season._

==============================================================================================

![Image 1: Manchester United's Joshua Zirkzee during the Premier League match at Portman Road, Ipswich.](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30485388.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ipswich-Town-v-Manchester-United-Premier-League-Portman-Road.jpg)

Joshua Zirkzee has been linked with a move away from Manchester United ahead of the January transfer window. (Image: Bradley Collyer/PA Wire.)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

It’s back to [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) action for Manchester United this weekend as [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) takes charge of his first league game at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

The new United head coach managed his first game at the Stadium on Thursday night. Goals from [Alejandro Garnacho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/alejandro-garnacho) and [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) (x2) saw the team come out as 3-2 winners over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) are back in action on Sunday when they take on Everton at Old Trafford (1.30pm kick-off). Going into the match, United sit in 12th place in the Premier League table, having picked up 16 points from their opening 12 games.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United duo show true Ruud van Nistelrooy feelings after new job confirmed](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-duo-show-true-30485198)**

**READ MORE: [Ruud van Nistelrooy first words as new job confirmed and Man United reunion date set](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872)**

While we wait for the match, there has, as ever, been stories doing the rounds at Old Trafford. We have therefore taken a look at a couple and also given our own thoughts on the situation.

#### Van Nistelrooy new job confirmed

[Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) has been [confirmed as the new manager of Leicester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-first-words-30484872), following his exit from Manchester United just under three weeks ago. The former striker joined United in the summer as Erik ten hag’s assistant and took interim charge for four games following the sacking of Ten Hag.

He has now signed a two-and-a-half year deal with the Foxes and will hope to lead the club to Premier League safety. It means a reunion with United is on the cards, with the meeting between the two clubs set for March 15 at the King Power Stadium.

_**MEN Sport Says**: After a successful stint as interim boss, it’s good to see Van Nistelrooy get a chance to manage in the Premier League and United fans will be watching how he gets on with interest. United could also make the most of the new link between the two clubs in the transfer window._

_Leicester may be keen to take some of United’s players either on loan (they will however have to free up a loan space in their squad in order to do so), or permanent deals. The link could be useful to both teams going forward and provides a new option for players struggling to break through at Old Trafford._

#### Joshua Zirkzee stance outlined

Ahead of the January transfer window, there has been a lot of talk over [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee), with Juventus linked with an interest in a potential loan deal just six months after he joined the club.

However, journalist Gianluca Di Marzio has now given the latest, confirming that a move to the Italian giants is not going to happen. “Joshua Zirkzee and Douglas Luiz are linked to other teams every day,” he told [Soccernews.nl](http://soccernews.nl/).

“Zirkzee to Juventus or Douglas Luiz back to the Premier League or Saudi Arabia, but they are out of the market at this moment. There are no chances or no discussion between Man Utd and the agent or Juventus and the agent, so they are happy to stay in Man Utd and Juventus.

“They want to stay at their clubs and demonstrate their values, so that´s not going to happen in January.”

_**MEN Sport Says:** While Zirkzee has had a slow start to life at Old Trafford, I think it’s best for the striker that he stays at United, especially given the arrival of Ruben Amorim. While he is struggling for starts, Zirkzee is still yet to miss a Premier League game this season, so it’s not like he’s not getting any game time._

_Working under Amorim will only benefit the 23-year-old. And he will hope to reap the benefits both the rest of the season and next season._

Ruben Amorim's first Man United transfer move could hand Man City millions
==========================================================================

Manchester United are reportedly considering a move for Ipswich Town striker Liam Delap in 2025 after his impressive start to life in the Premier League
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tom SunderlandSports Writer

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim looks on](https://i2-prod.coventrytelegraph.net/incoming/article30484605.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-FK-BodoGlimt-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD5.jpg)

Manchester [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc)'s potential first signing under new manager [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) could inadvertently enrich their city rivals.

The Reds are said to be eyeing up Ipswich Town's Liam Delap, who has been in scintillating form since his move from [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The 21 year old striker, who had loan spells at Stoke City and Preston before a standout stint at Hull City, has netted six times in his first 13 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) games for Ipswich.

However, should United make a move for Delap, City would benefit from a 20 per cent sell-on clause in his contract. This means that Pep Guardiola's side would receive a portion of any future transfer fee, regardless of where he ends up. Delap's value is likely to have increased significantly after proving his worth in the top flight this season.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United wonderkid Chido Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

**READ MORE: ['Proper footballer' - Ruben Amorim sends message to Mason Mount after Manchester United comeback](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/proper-footballer-ruben-amorim-sends-30479463)**

The son of former Stoke star Rory Delap, he played a crucial role in Ipswich's first-ever Premier League win over Tottenham and scored twice in a draw with Aston Villa, as well as netting an equaliser against Fulham.

Amorim experienced first-hand the skills of Delap during his United dugout debut at Portman Road, where his team were held to a 1-1 draw. The Winchester-born talent nearly scored with two shots on target despite only taking 17 touches against United, with only Marcus Rashford (13) taking fewer, reports [the Express](https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1982475/man-utd-ruben-amorim-city-transfer-clause).

Interest in Delap has emerged just as Rasmus Hojlund is beginning to shine under Amorim. The Dane netted twice and provided an assist as United defeated Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt 3-2 on Thursday, securing their second victory of the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) campaign.

Hojlund, also 21, aims to justify his £72m transfer fee by emulating the success Viktor Gyokeres enjoyed under Amorim at Sporting CP. United also have striker options in Rashford and summer recruit Joshua Zirkzee, although neither has managed to maintain consistent form this season.

It seems unlikely City will exercise their buy-back clause to reunite with Delap given their striker position is covered. Erling Haaland continues to top the Premier League goal charts with 12 goals so far this term and is rumoured to be signing a new lucrative contract at the Etihad.

Having experienced top-tier football under McKenna, Delap won't want to play a secondary role should he move next year. However, depending on his new value, United may have to indirectly give their fierce rivals a substantial sum if they wish to secure the player.

Ruben Amorim's first Man United transfer move could hand Man City millions
==========================================================================

Manchester United are reportedly considering a move for Ipswich Town striker Liam Delap in 2025 after his impressive start to life in the Premier League
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Tom SunderlandSports Writer

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim looks on](https://i2-prod.coventrytelegraph.net/incoming/article30484605.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-FK-BodoGlimt-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD5.jpg)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Manchester [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc)'s potential first signing under new manager [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) could inadvertently enrich their city rivals.

The Reds are said to be eyeing up Ipswich Town's Liam Delap, who has been in scintillating form since his move from [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The 21 year old striker, who had loan spells at Stoke City and Preston before a standout stint at Hull City, has netted six times in his first 13 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) games for Ipswich.

However, should United make a move for Delap, City would benefit from a 20 per cent sell-on clause in his contract. This means that Pep Guardiola's side would receive a portion of any future transfer fee, regardless of where he ends up. Delap's value is likely to have increased significantly after proving his worth in the top flight this season.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United wonderkid Chido Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

**READ MORE: ['Proper footballer' - Ruben Amorim sends message to Mason Mount after Manchester United comeback](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/proper-footballer-ruben-amorim-sends-30479463)**

The son of former Stoke star Rory Delap, he played a crucial role in Ipswich's first-ever Premier League win over Tottenham and scored twice in a draw with Aston Villa, as well as netting an equaliser against Fulham.

Amorim experienced first-hand the skills of Delap during his United dugout debut at Portman Road, where his team were held to a 1-1 draw. The Winchester-born talent nearly scored with two shots on target despite only taking 17 touches against United, with only Marcus Rashford (13) taking fewer, reports [the Express](https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1982475/man-utd-ruben-amorim-city-transfer-clause).

Interest in Delap has emerged just as Rasmus Hojlund is beginning to shine under Amorim. The Dane netted twice and provided an assist as United defeated Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt 3-2 on Thursday, securing their second victory of the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) campaign.

Hojlund, also 21, aims to justify his £72m transfer fee by emulating the success Viktor Gyokeres enjoyed under Amorim at Sporting CP. United also have striker options in Rashford and summer recruit Joshua Zirkzee, although neither has managed to maintain consistent form this season.

It seems unlikely City will exercise their buy-back clause to reunite with Delap given their striker position is covered. Erling Haaland continues to top the Premier League goal charts with 12 goals so far this term and is rumoured to be signing a new lucrative contract at the Etihad.

Having experienced top-tier football under McKenna, Delap won't want to play a secondary role should he move next year. However, depending on his new value, United may have to indirectly give their fierce rivals a substantial sum if they wish to secure the player.

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Ruben Amorim's first Man United transfer move could hand Man City millions
==========================================================================

Manchester United are reportedly considering a move for Ipswich Town striker Liam Delap in 2025 after his impressive start to life in the Premier League
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Share

*   [Comments12](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorims-first-man-united-30484565#comments-wrapper "Comments")

By

[Isaac Seelochan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/isaac-seelochan/)Senior Sport Central Audience Writer

Tom SunderlandSports Writer

*   20:00, 29 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim looks on](https://i2-prod.coventrytelegraph.net/incoming/article30484605.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Manchester-United-v-FK-BodoGlimt-UEFA-Europa-League-202425-League-Phase-MD5.jpg)

Manchester United have been linked with Liam Delap as Ruben Amorim eyes his first signing at Old Trafford (Image: Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc)'s potential first signing under new manager [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) could inadvertently enrich their city rivals.

The Reds are said to be eyeing up Ipswich Town's Liam Delap, who has been in scintillating form since his move from [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The 21 year old striker, who had loan spells at Stoke City and Preston before a standout stint at Hull City, has netted six times in his first 13 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) games for Ipswich.

However, should United make a move for Delap, City would benefit from a 20 per cent sell-on clause in his contract. This means that Pep Guardiola's side would receive a portion of any future transfer fee, regardless of where he ends up. Delap's value is likely to have increased significantly after proving his worth in the top flight this season.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United wonderkid Chido Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

**READ MORE: ['Proper footballer' - Ruben Amorim sends message to Mason Mount after Manchester United comeback](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/proper-footballer-ruben-amorim-sends-30479463)**

The son of former Stoke star Rory Delap, he played a crucial role in Ipswich's first-ever Premier League win over Tottenham and scored twice in a draw with Aston Villa, as well as netting an equaliser against Fulham.

Amorim experienced first-hand the skills of Delap during his United dugout debut at Portman Road, where his team were held to a 1-1 draw. The Winchester-born talent nearly scored with two shots on target despite only taking 17 touches against United, with only Marcus Rashford (13) taking fewer, reports [the Express](https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1982475/man-utd-ruben-amorim-city-transfer-clause).

Interest in Delap has emerged just as Rasmus Hojlund is beginning to shine under Amorim. The Dane netted twice and provided an assist as United defeated Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt 3-2 on Thursday, securing their second victory of the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) campaign.

Hojlund, also 21, aims to justify his £72m transfer fee by emulating the success Viktor Gyokeres enjoyed under Amorim at Sporting CP. United also have striker options in Rashford and summer recruit Joshua Zirkzee, although neither has managed to maintain consistent form this season.

It seems unlikely City will exercise their buy-back clause to reunite with Delap given their striker position is covered. Erling Haaland continues to top the Premier League goal charts with 12 goals so far this term and is rumoured to be signing a new lucrative contract at the Etihad.

Having experienced top-tier football under McKenna, Delap won't want to play a secondary role should he move next year. However, depending on his new value, United may have to indirectly give their fierce rivals a substantial sum if they wish to secure the player.

Manchester [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc)'s potential first signing under new manager [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) could inadvertently enrich their city rivals.

The Reds are said to be eyeing up Ipswich Town's Liam Delap, who has been in scintillating form since his move from [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc). The 21 year old striker, who had loan spells at Stoke City and Preston before a standout stint at Hull City, has netted six times in his first 13 [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) games for Ipswich.

However, should United make a move for Delap, City would benefit from a 20 per cent sell-on clause in his contract. This means that Pep Guardiola's side would receive a portion of any future transfer fee, regardless of where he ends up. Delap's value is likely to have increased significantly after proving his worth in the top flight this season.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United wonderkid Chido Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

**READ MORE: ['Proper footballer' - Ruben Amorim sends message to Mason Mount after Manchester United comeback](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/proper-footballer-ruben-amorim-sends-30479463)**

The son of former Stoke star Rory Delap, he played a crucial role in Ipswich's first-ever Premier League win over Tottenham and scored twice in a draw with Aston Villa, as well as netting an equaliser against Fulham.

Amorim experienced first-hand the skills of Delap during his United dugout debut at Portman Road, where his team were held to a 1-1 draw. The Winchester-born talent nearly scored with two shots on target despite only taking 17 touches against United, with only Marcus Rashford (13) taking fewer, reports [the Express](https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/1982475/man-utd-ruben-amorim-city-transfer-clause).

Interest in Delap has emerged just as Rasmus Hojlund is beginning to shine under Amorim. The Dane netted twice and provided an assist as United defeated Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt 3-2 on Thursday, securing their second victory of the [Europa League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/europa-league) campaign.

Hojlund, also 21, aims to justify his £72m transfer fee by emulating the success Viktor Gyokeres enjoyed under Amorim at Sporting CP. United also have striker options in Rashford and summer recruit Joshua Zirkzee, although neither has managed to maintain consistent form this season.

It seems unlikely City will exercise their buy-back clause to reunite with Delap given their striker position is covered. Erling Haaland continues to top the Premier League goal charts with 12 goals so far this term and is rumoured to be signing a new lucrative contract at the Etihad.

Having experienced top-tier football under McKenna, Delap won't want to play a secondary role should he move next year. However, depending on his new value, United may have to indirectly give their fierce rivals a substantial sum if they wish to secure the player.

Ineos demand, personal promise, player meetings - Inside Ruben Amorim's Man United
==================================================================================

Manchester United are at the beginning of a new era and Ruben Amorim is confident he is the man to bring success back to Old Trafford
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   17:50, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim acknowledges the Manchester United supporters](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488313.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187478137.jpg)

Ruben Amorim replaced Erik ten Hag at Manchester United in November (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In his first press conference as Manchester United head coach, Ruben Amorim told reporters that he had full faith he is the right man, at the right time, to bring success back to the Reds.

It was music to supporters' ears, and it is fair to say that [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) enthusiasm has been infectious so far even if we have yet to see radical improvements on the pitch. The optimism from the head coach has not dampened following the opening two matches.

"I believe we will succeed," Amorim told the [BBC](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr) at the end of his interview with the broadcaster. "I think United will change my life but it will not change me.

**READ MORE: [Amorim gives Malacia verdict](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

**READ MORE: [Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

"Everybody says this will change me… this will not change me." This shall likely please [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) fans considering the personality of Amorim is one which has drawn admiration from supporters so far.

"I think it is more powerful sometimes not to shout because when you are, you are and the players feel it," he explained. "In training you can be demanding but afterwards, you can be one of them.

"To have a real connection you have to be in their shoes." Unlike a lot of the old-school managers of yesteryear, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) attended university in Portugal to learn how to manage his squad and even visited a therapist to, in his words, 'change things' about him as he transitioned from a player to a manager.

Part of this journey taught Amorim to evolve his style to suit different members of his squad. One-to-one meetings with his players are going to be a regular part of the schedule for the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) squad but these will take the form of informal chats on the way to the training pitch rather than mirror [Jose Mourinho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jose-mourinho) style of calling players to his office.

It would be easy to describe Amorim as 'Mr. Nice Guy' but he has his ruthless streak. As a player, he was suspended twice by his manager and he has no desire to allow standards to slip.

  

![Image 3: Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488300.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2187478251.jpg)

Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League

"For me, some rules are for all but I treat my players differently because they are different people," he explained. "I deal with each one of them in a different way.

"You can have some red lines that you cannot cross no matter who you are, but I deal with the players completely differently because they are different people." And the squad are not the only ones who will be set red lines.

Ineos are on notice too. Despite his deep affection for Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) club is Benfica.

He had the chance to join them as head coach while at Braga but admitted he rejected them because he felt he would not have full control in their system. Logic dictates that Amorim must feel he will have this control at United or else he would not have made the jump.

It is going to be a learning curve for Amorim in England, one which he has already acknowledged due to the media commitments and the size of United. But what is clear, is that the new boss will wish to put his own stamp on the club to take the Reds back to the top.

===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Ineos demand, personal promise, player meetings - Inside Ruben Amorim's Man United
==================================================================================

Manchester United are at the beginning of a new era and Ruben Amorim is confident he is the man to bring success back to Old Trafford
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ineos-demand-personal-promise-player-30488201#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   17:50, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim acknowledges the Manchester United supporters](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488313.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187478137.jpg)

Ruben Amorim replaced Erik ten Hag at Manchester United in November (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In his first press conference as Manchester United head coach, Ruben Amorim told reporters that he had full faith he is the right man, at the right time, to bring success back to the Reds.

It was music to supporters' ears, and it is fair to say that [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) enthusiasm has been infectious so far even if we have yet to see radical improvements on the pitch. The optimism from the head coach has not dampened following the opening two matches.

"I believe we will succeed," Amorim told the [BBC](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr) at the end of his interview with the broadcaster. "I think United will change my life but it will not change me.

**READ MORE: [Amorim gives Malacia verdict](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

**READ MORE: [Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

"Everybody says this will change me… this will not change me." This shall likely please [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) fans considering the personality of Amorim is one which has drawn admiration from supporters so far.

"I think it is more powerful sometimes not to shout because when you are, you are and the players feel it," he explained. "In training you can be demanding but afterwards, you can be one of them.

"To have a real connection you have to be in their shoes." Unlike a lot of the old-school managers of yesteryear, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) attended university in Portugal to learn how to manage his squad and even visited a therapist to, in his words, 'change things' about him as he transitioned from a player to a manager.

Part of this journey taught Amorim to evolve his style to suit different members of his squad. One-to-one meetings with his players are going to be a regular part of the schedule for the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) squad but these will take the form of informal chats on the way to the training pitch rather than mirror [Jose Mourinho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jose-mourinho) style of calling players to his office.

It would be easy to describe Amorim as 'Mr. Nice Guy' but he has his ruthless streak. As a player, he was suspended twice by his manager and he has no desire to allow standards to slip.

  

![Image 3: Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488300.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2187478251.jpg)

Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League

"For me, some rules are for all but I treat my players differently because they are different people," he explained. "I deal with each one of them in a different way.

"You can have some red lines that you cannot cross no matter who you are, but I deal with the players completely differently because they are different people." And the squad are not the only ones who will be set red lines.

Ineos are on notice too. Despite his deep affection for Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) club is Benfica.

He had the chance to join them as head coach while at Braga but admitted he rejected them because he felt he would not have full control in their system. Logic dictates that Amorim must feel he will have this control at United or else he would not have made the jump.

It is going to be a learning curve for Amorim in England, one which he has already acknowledged due to the media commitments and the size of United. But what is clear, is that the new boss will wish to put his own stamp on the club to take the Reds back to the top.

Ineos demand, personal promise, player meetings - Inside Ruben Amorim's Man United
==================================================================================

Manchester United are at the beginning of a new era and Ruben Amorim is confident he is the man to bring success back to Old Trafford
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ineos-demand-personal-promise-player-30488201#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   17:50, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim acknowledges the Manchester United supporters](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488313.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187478137.jpg)

Ruben Amorim replaced Erik ten Hag at Manchester United in November (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In his first press conference as Manchester United head coach, Ruben Amorim told reporters that he had full faith he is the right man, at the right time, to bring success back to the Reds.

It was music to supporters' ears, and it is fair to say that [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) enthusiasm has been infectious so far even if we have yet to see radical improvements on the pitch. The optimism from the head coach has not dampened following the opening two matches.

"I believe we will succeed," Amorim told the [BBC](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr) at the end of his interview with the broadcaster. "I think United will change my life but it will not change me.

**READ MORE: [Amorim gives Malacia verdict](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

**READ MORE: [Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

"Everybody says this will change me… this will not change me." This shall likely please [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) fans considering the personality of Amorim is one which has drawn admiration from supporters so far.

"I think it is more powerful sometimes not to shout because when you are, you are and the players feel it," he explained. "In training you can be demanding but afterwards, you can be one of them.

"To have a real connection you have to be in their shoes." Unlike a lot of the old-school managers of yesteryear, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) attended university in Portugal to learn how to manage his squad and even visited a therapist to, in his words, 'change things' about him as he transitioned from a player to a manager.

Part of this journey taught Amorim to evolve his style to suit different members of his squad. One-to-one meetings with his players are going to be a regular part of the schedule for the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) squad but these will take the form of informal chats on the way to the training pitch rather than mirror [Jose Mourinho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jose-mourinho) style of calling players to his office.

It would be easy to describe Amorim as 'Mr. Nice Guy' but he has his ruthless streak. As a player, he was suspended twice by his manager and he has no desire to allow standards to slip.

  

![Image 3: Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488300.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2187478251.jpg)

Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League

"For me, some rules are for all but I treat my players differently because they are different people," he explained. "I deal with each one of them in a different way.

"You can have some red lines that you cannot cross no matter who you are, but I deal with the players completely differently because they are different people." And the squad are not the only ones who will be set red lines.

Ineos are on notice too. Despite his deep affection for Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) club is Benfica.

He had the chance to join them as head coach while at Braga but admitted he rejected them because he felt he would not have full control in their system. Logic dictates that Amorim must feel he will have this control at United or else he would not have made the jump.

It is going to be a learning curve for Amorim in England, one which he has already acknowledged due to the media commitments and the size of United. But what is clear, is that the new boss will wish to put his own stamp on the club to take the Reds back to the top.

===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Ineos demand, personal promise, player meetings - Inside Ruben Amorim's Man United
==================================================================================

Manchester United are at the beginning of a new era and Ruben Amorim is confident he is the man to bring success back to Old Trafford
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ineos-demand-personal-promise-player-30488201#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   17:50, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim acknowledges the Manchester United supporters](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488313.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187478137.jpg)

Ruben Amorim replaced Erik ten Hag at Manchester United in November (Image: James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In his first press conference as Manchester United head coach, Ruben Amorim told reporters that he had full faith he is the right man, at the right time, to bring success back to the Reds.

It was music to supporters' ears, and it is fair to say that [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) enthusiasm has been infectious so far even if we have yet to see radical improvements on the pitch. The optimism from the head coach has not dampened following the opening two matches.

"I believe we will succeed," Amorim told the [BBC](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k7y4sr) at the end of his interview with the broadcaster. "I think United will change my life but it will not change me.

**READ MORE: [Amorim gives Malacia verdict](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-gives-tyrell-malacia-30487790)**

**READ MORE: [Ratcliffe and Ineos are betraying United fans](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/sir-jim-ratcliffe-ineos-betraying-30480953)**

"Everybody says this will change me… this will not change me." This shall likely please [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) fans considering the personality of Amorim is one which has drawn admiration from supporters so far.

"I think it is more powerful sometimes not to shout because when you are, you are and the players feel it," he explained. "In training you can be demanding but afterwards, you can be one of them.

"To have a real connection you have to be in their shoes." Unlike a lot of the old-school managers of yesteryear, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) attended university in Portugal to learn how to manage his squad and even visited a therapist to, in his words, 'change things' about him as he transitioned from a player to a manager.

Part of this journey taught Amorim to evolve his style to suit different members of his squad. One-to-one meetings with his players are going to be a regular part of the schedule for the [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) squad but these will take the form of informal chats on the way to the training pitch rather than mirror [Jose Mourinho's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jose-mourinho) style of calling players to his office.

It would be easy to describe Amorim as 'Mr. Nice Guy' but he has his ruthless streak. As a player, he was suspended twice by his manager and he has no desire to allow standards to slip.

  

![Image 3: Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30488300.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2187478251.jpg)

Ruben Amorim smiles after Manchester United's victory over Bodo/Glimt in the Europa League

"For me, some rules are for all but I treat my players differently because they are different people," he explained. "I deal with each one of them in a different way.

"You can have some red lines that you cannot cross no matter who you are, but I deal with the players completely differently because they are different people." And the squad are not the only ones who will be set red lines.

Ineos are on notice too. Despite his deep affection for Sporting Lisbon, [Amorim's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) club is Benfica.

He had the chance to join them as head coach while at Braga but admitted he rejected them because he felt he would not have full control in their system. Logic dictates that Amorim must feel he will have this control at United or else he would not have made the jump.

It is going to be a learning curve for Amorim in England, one which he has already acknowledged due to the media commitments and the size of United. But what is clear, is that the new boss will wish to put his own stamp on the club to take the Reds back to the top.

Manchester United history is about to repeat itself with £72million player - and it's good news
===============================================================================================

Rasmus Hojlund scored a brace in the Europa League on Thursday night and he must kick on after that display.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

![Image 1: Steven Railston](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article24068665.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_SRHeadshot.jpg)

By

[Steven Railston](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/steven-railston/)Manchester United Writer

*   07:00, 30 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30481092.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/1_GettyImages-2187348816.jpg)

Hojlund scored twice against Bodo/Glimt. (Image: 2024 Manchester United FC)

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

Just as Ramsus Hojlund found his stride last season, he picked an injury that disrupted his rhythm.

[Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) sustained a muscle injury against Luton Town on February 18 and confirmation that he was facing a few weeks on the sidelines came after he scored seven goals in six games.

The young striker scored in successive games against Tottenham, Newport County, Wolves, West Ham, Aston Villa and Luton but actually turned a corner before that run of games.

Hojlund had no problem scoring in the Champions League group stage, impressively scoring five times in Europe, but he had to wait until December to score his first goal in the Premier League, finally getting that monkey off his back when scoring a brace against Villa on Boxing Day.

**ALSO READ:** **[Ratcliffe must make a U-turn after United price hike](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/kick-teeth-sir-jim-ratcliffe-30475527)**

**ALSO READ: [Wonderkid Obi-Martin signs first professional contract](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-wonderkid-chido-obi-30477567)**

During the period that Hojlund hadn't scored in the league, he played it down but he was clearly relieved when he got off the mark. Shortly afterwards, Hojlund enjoyed a purple patch and United's unbeaten streak suddenly ended in the first game that he was unavailable with injury.

That didn't feel like a coincidence, although Hojlund didn't return from his injury in the same vein of form and Bruno Fernandes started as the false nine in the FA Cup final at Wembley.

It was a disappointing end to the campaign for Hojlund, who subsequently struggled for Denmark at Euro 2024 and picked up a hamstring injury in his first appearance of pre-season.

Hojlund made his comeback against [Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) in September. He later scored against FC Porto and Brentford, but he was beginning to look like a player whose confidence was suffering and that's why it was so great to see him net a brace in the Europe League on Thursday night.

Alejandro Garnacho scored the opening goal against Bodo/Glimt but Hojlund created it with his aggressive pressing and his equaliser on the stroke of half-time was brilliantly taken.

  

![Image 4: Rasmus Hojlund](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30476684.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_GettyImages-2187360958.jpg)

There is more to come from Hojlund.

Hojund's touch to control Noussair Mazraoui's cross was superb and the finish was even better. It was tremendous goal from a technical perspective and his second goal was a 'proper striker's goal', with Hojlund sweeping home Mason Mount's low, driven cross from close range.

The smile was back on Hojlund's face when he spoke to MUTV to reflect on the performance and he described his matchwinner in the second half as the perfect "Rasmus Hojlund goal."

There is now a strong case for Hojlund to retain his starting role against Everton this weekend and history has a tendency to repeat itself, so he could be on the verge of a purple patch again.

Confidence is crucial in elite sport and strikers can be streaky creatures who go on a prolific run after a strong performance, just like Hojlund did at the start of the year. After scoring a brace on Boxing Day, Hojlund exploded into life and perhaps lightening could strike twice.

Ruben Amorim said about Hojlund in his press conference: "I think he improved the connection. I think he has to improve more because sometimes he gives too many touches when he holds the ball.

"But he’s really important for us because when we are in the low block he is the guy to hold the ball, to connect for transitions, he did that very well and he has that characteristic.

"He was aggressive in the goals, he was aggressive in the box and he is a quality player. I think he scores the most difficult goals so he has a lot to improve. Is the same for every player but he did a great job."

Hojlund said when conducting his media duties that Amorim's system suits him because he played in a similar formation with Atalanta and the pair could develop a healthy marriage.

United need Hojlund to score regularly and it feels like he's about to turn a corner again.
